intro: Canthium ankaranense, commonly known as the Ankaranese spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, milky sap and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by colorful bracts that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
